SummaryEnglish: Castor lives in the forest of Clairefontaine with his father -- his mother died when he was a baby. He misses his mother terribly and his love for her is reflected through his looking into the sky and 'talking' to her, resulting in a vision of the deceased, usually in the moon during the night. Family relationships are more often than not a focus of the series, through reunions, finding lost relatives and conflicts between family and friends, the latter sometimes resulting in a character running away from home. Happily, these situations end on a positive note.

1.SummaryEnglish: Castor's rabbit friend Mimi decides to run away from home because her parents won't stop arguing.

2.SummaryEnglish: Castor and his friends help reunite Minouchette -- a kitten -- with her older brother.

3.SummaryEnglish: Feeling unfairly treated by their parents, Castor and his friends decide to build their own clubhouse.

4.SummaryEnglish: Garou attempts to take advantage of Castor's acts of heroism by asking him to construct a swimming pool -- by himself.

5.SummaryEnglish: Castor and Daigo travel to the Dark Valley for honey needed to help Nounours' ailing mother.

6.SummaryEnglish: Garou convinces the animals of Clairefontaine that Castor's father practises black magic prior to a solar eclipse.

7.TitleEnglish: Le livre des contes/Castor And The Beanstalk
7.SummaryEnglish: Castor is the hero in this version of the fairy tale, 'Jack And The Beanstalk'.

8.SummaryEnglish: Castor builds a wooden chariot to give Lily her birthday present -- a tour of Clairefontaine -- after she's injured by one of Finaud's traps.

9.SummaryEnglish: A young squirrel acts like a brat towards everyone he meets and no one knows why.

10.SummaryEnglish: Everyone is curious to know what Castor's father is doing in the forest in the middle of the night.

11.SummaryEnglish: Garou's grandfather chooses to depend on repeating a magic phrase to cure his injured leg, rather than have Dr. Bouc perform surgery on it.

12.SummaryEnglish: Castor races to save Finaud after he eats a poisoned mushroom and Lily and Daigo from a trio of leopard bandits -- all before sundown.

13.SummaryEnglish: Castor's new friend Tirelaine -- the former leopard bandit -- is being framed for robberies he hasn't committed.

14.TitleEnglish: La m√¢choire de monstre/The Monster's Jaw
14.SummaryEnglish: During a cleanup of the forest, Castor discovers a jaw with sharp teeth -- and a trap is set to determine who it belongs to.

15.SummaryEnglish: Castor runs away after he's punished for accidentally ruining a painting his father was working on.

16.SummaryEnglish: Castor attempts to care for an eaglet after he and Lily find an abandoned egg -- unaware that the mother is looking for it.

17.SummaryEnglish: The animals of Clairefontaine prepare for the worst when Castor's father warns of a rainstorm and subsequent flood that are about to hit -- except Garou and his friends.

18.SummaryEnglish: Garou is frustrated when he can't seem to defeat Castor in any physical competition -- and that he'll embarass the Garou family name.

19.SummaryEnglish: Daigo discovers what looks like a mermaid in the forest pond -- who's captured by Garou for use as a sideshow attraction.

20.TitleEnglish: La dynastie de Rotanovich/Lourdaud Becomes A Hero
20.SummaryEnglish: A situation involving a raccoon with a fraudulent claim to ruling Clairefontaine results in an unlikely hero in Lourdaud, not long after he's excommunicated by Garou.

21.SummaryEnglish: Finaud attempts to exploit everyone's belief in a 'lightning spirit' after a thunderstorm hits Clairefontaine.

22.TitleEnglish: Le chateau de sucre/A Strange Trip
22.SummaryEnglish: Finaud's rafting trip to what he believes is a castle made of candy results in Castor and LIly taking care of him when he falls ill with a fever.

23.SummaryEnglish: Castor, Lily and Daigo hatch a plan to rid Clairefontaine of a greedy wolf named Dracula who claims himself to be 'emperor' -- after the wolf soundly prevents Castor from rescuing Mimi.

24.SummaryEnglish: Lourdaud becomes the strongest in Clairefontaine to everyone's amazement, unaware that it's really his lookalike uncle Nostradamus, who only wants his nephew to be more sly and courageous.

25.TitleEnglish: Le maitre et seigneur de la foret/The Invaders
25.SummaryEnglish: The animals of Clairefontaine fight off an invasion led by Balthazar the lion.

26.SummaryEnglish: A search for a ghost in the forest results in Castor, Lily and Daigo befriending a hermit warthog.

1.SummaryEnglish: Drawings by a talented travelling artist materialize into the real thing for Castor, Lily and Daigo.
